title: Microsoft Exchange TorusUpdateInitialSessionState Uncontrolled Search Path Element Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Microsoft Exchange. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the TorusUpdateInitialSessionState function. The function loads a library from an unsecured location. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of SYSTEM.
addtionnal_details: Microsoft has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2023-21763
timeline:
2022-11-11 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2023-01-18 - Coordinated public release of advisory
credit: Piotr Bazydlo (@chudypb) of Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative
